p: The genus Thymus (Lamiaceae) includes about 350 species, mostly with a high content of essential oil ( Ghasemi Pirbalouti et al., 2015; Salehi et al., 2019). This is mostly distributed in Europe, Asia, and North Africa ( Zarshenas and Krenn, 2015) and the vast majority of Thymus species are found in and around Mediterranean areas ( Niculae et al., 2019). Two native species of thymus, namely Thymus serrulatus and Thymus schimperi, are found in Ethiopia and both are locally known as Tosign (Amharic) and Tesni/Thasne (Tigrigna) ( Damtie and Mekonnen, 2015).
